org.sakaiproject.util

Class Web

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sakaiproject.util.Web
  • Deprecated. 
    use apache commons utils for FormattedText, this will be removed after 2.9 - Dec 2011

    @Deprecated
public class Web
extends Object

    Web is a web (html, http, etc) technlogies collection of helper methods.

    • Method Detail

      • escapeHtml

        public static String escapeHtml(String value)
        Deprecated. this is a passthrough for FormattedText.escapeHtml(String, boolean) so use that instead
        Escape a plaintext string so that it can be output as part of an HTML document. Amperstand, greater-than, less-than, newlines, etc, will be escaped so that they display (instead of being interpreted as formatting).
        Parameters:
        value - The string to escape.
        Returns:
        value fully escaped for HTML.

      • escapeHtmlFormattedText

        public static String escapeHtmlFormattedText(String value)
        Deprecated. this is a passthrough for FormattedText.escapeHtmlFormattedText(String) so use that instead
        Escape HTML-formatted text in preparation to include it in an HTML document.
        Parameters:
        value - The string to escape.
        Returns:
        value escaped for HTML.

      • escapeHtml

        public static String escapeHtml(String value,
                boolean escapeNewlines)
        Deprecated. this is a passthrough for FormattedText.escapeHtml(String, boolean) so use that instead
        Escape the given value so that it appears as-is in HTML - that is, HTML meta-characters like '<' are escaped to HTML character entity references like '<'. Markup, amper, quote are escaped. Whitespace is not.
        Parameters:
        value - The string to escape.
        escapeNewlines - Whether to escape newlines as "<br />\n" so that they appear as HTML line breaks.
        Returns:
        value fully escaped for HTML.

      • escapeJsQuoted

        public static String escapeJsQuoted(String value)
        Deprecated. Use http://commons.apache.org/lang/api/org/apache/commons/lang/StringEscapeUtils.html instead (see KNL-69).
        Return a string based on value that is safe to place into a javascript value that is in single quiotes.
        Parameters:
        value - The string to escape.
        Returns:
        value escaped.

      • escapeUrl

        public static String escapeUrl(String id)
        Deprecated. just a passthrough for Validator.escapeUrl(String) so use that instead
        Return a string based on id that is fully escaped using URL rules, using a UTF-8 underlying encoding. Note: java.net.URLEncode.encode() provides a more standard option FormattedText.decodeNumericCharacterReferences() undoes this op
        Parameters:
        id - The string to escape.
        Returns:
        id fully escaped using URL rules.

      • unEscapeHtml

        public static String unEscapeHtml(String value)
        Deprecated. just a copy of FormattedText.unEscapeHtml(String) so use that instead
        Returns a String with HTML entity references converted to characters suitable for processing as formatted text.
        Parameters:
        value - The text containing entity references (e.g., a News item description).
        Returns:
        The HTML, ready for processing.

      • encodeUrlsAsHtml

        public static String encodeUrlsAsHtml(String text)
        Deprecated. just a copy of FormattedText.encodeUrlsAsHtml(String) so use that instead
        For converting plain-text URLs in a String to HTML <a> tags Any URLs in the source text that happen to be already in a <a> tag will be unaffected.
        Parameters:
        text - the plain text to convert
        Returns:
        the full source text with URLs converted to HTML.

      • escapeJavascript

        public static String escapeJavascript(String value)
        Deprecated. 
        Return a string based on value that is safe to place into a javascript / html identifier: anything not alphanumeric change to 'x'. If the first character is not alphabetic, a letter 'i' is prepended.
        Parameters:
        value - The string to escape.
        Returns:
        value fully escaped using javascript / html identifier rules.

      • hexDigit

        protected static final char hexDigit(int i)
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the hex digit cooresponding to a number between 0 and 15.
        Parameters:
        i - The number to get the hex digit for.
        Returns:
        The hex digit cooresponding to that number.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If supplied digit is not between 0 and 15 inclusive.

      • makePath

        public static String makePath(String[] parts,
              int start,
              int end)
        Deprecated. 
        Form a path string from the parts of the array starting at index start to the end, each with a '/' in front.
        Parameters:
        parts - The parts strings
        start - The index of the first part to use
        end - The index past the last part to use
        Returns:
        a path string from the parts of the array starting at index start to the end, each with a '/' in front.

        Deprecated.

        Parameters:

      • sendAutoUpdate

        public static void sendAutoUpdate(PrintWriter out,
                  javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                  String placementId,
                  int updateTime)
        Deprecated. To avoid inappropriate kernel dependencies, construct this URL in the tool pending relocation of this to courier (see SAK-18481).
        Send the HTML / Javascript to invoke an automatic update
        Parameters:
        out -
        req - The request.
        placementId - The tool's placement id / presence location / part of the delivery address
        updateTime - The time (seconds) between courier checks

      • serverUrl

        public static String serverUrl(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
        Deprecated. use RequestFilter.serverUrl
        Compute the URL that would return to this server based on the current request. Note: this method is duplicated in the /sakai-kernel-api/src/main/java/org/sakaiproject/util/RequestFilter.java
        Parameters:
        req - The request.
        Returns:
        The URL back to this server based on the current request.
